text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new Jota Lea
record home like no place is there these
guys are in Massachusetts rock outfit
whose sophomore record right here
dropped a little earlier this year upon
first impression it didn't really grab
me if you get into this LP you're gonna
find a lot of very shouty melodic sort
of dramatic and poetic and punk spirited
rock music that many would call emo a
genre of music
I know fairly well I love the bands that
make up this genres roots in the in the
80s and 90s like kappa jazz american
football Sunny Day Real Estate
jawbreaker as well as mineral and let's
not forget rites of spring whoo I
remember getting into just because
around that time I was a big Fugazi fan
that time being college and the reason I
got into this style of music in college
is because it was continuing to dish out
really good memorable artists that a lot
of people were excited for like brand
new as well as envy or like gospel or
page 99 or circle takes the square if
you'll you know allow me to uh
throw some screamo bands not just
strictly emo bands in the mix but
simultaneously as there were these
really creative interesting bands in the
underground emo was also seeing quite a
bit of mainstream success thanks to get
up kids jimmy world Dashboard
Confessional to a lesser extent what
Conor Oberst was doing in bright eyes
and while the style is not really as
relevant mainstream wise as it used to
be it's never really died in the
underground however right now there is a
bit of an emo revival going on however I
wouldn't really say that's the case as
much as there is just a brand new young
audience out there for it with a brand
new young group of bands playing it
snowing the world is a beautiful place a
lot of the stuff that goes on with top
shelf records crash of rhinos and
screamo music right now is is generally
pretty healthy as well so after years of
being a fan of this stuff I'm sad to say
that a lot of the time when I come
across these newer groups they don't
really have a whole lot to offer me in
terms of
of a new idea or even a terribly
distinct sound though I do have some
favorites like the world is a beautiful
place you know where from my home state
as well as if you'll allow me to throw
to Chez amore and there even though they
are technically as screamo act I'm just
not finding a lot of artists out there
in the genre that are cutting edge and
no that is not like a suicide pun
however I guess in a sense it doesn't
have to be since emo is not known for
pushing the envelope it's known for
being emotional but even if a band isn't
really like totally reinventing an
entire style of music I like to hear
something that makes me feel like ah
that's what the sound this band has goes
for you know that's what their sound is
like that's how I know a hotel your song
and I wasn't really getting that when I
first heard the band when I first heard
them I thought they followed the
blueprint of this style of music just a
little too close for comfort to the
point where I just didn't find a whole
lot about them that was memorable
however what kind of made me change my
mind and revisit this LP is not only
were tons of people recommending it to
me every chance they possibly could but
also I think the songwriting on this
thing is pretty good and more ambitious
than the average group in this style as
well especially with the opener here
which is aptly titled
as an introduction to the album this is
probably one of the best starters to a
record I've heard in this style in a
while I love the gently strum guitars on
this track of course they're thin
they're twinkly they're bare they're dry
the vocal melody is really nice and the
way the pianos come in later in the
track it's just a really well put
together song and even though the hotel
ear just sticks to this blueprint really
passionately I do not foresee them
letting go of it or even really
venturing outside of it on the rest of
the album even as I am enjoying this
track it's still nice to hear a band who
clearly has a strong appreciation for
melody as well as vocal harmony it's
this musical detail and effort and the
pretty good performances that go into
this record - as well as the decent
production that make me feel like the
hotelier while they do stick to this
archetype early closely there are cut
above a lot of these bands that are
doing the same thing but are just too
for me to want to enjoy this bands
lyrics are actually pretty readable a
lot of the time to do this song as well
as others on here are pretty dynamic
some tracks on here like the track in
framing feature really huge group chorus
vocals that feel harmonized and shouted
very nicely the band really knows how to
put a song together but still
stylistically there is a really strong
element of blandness in my opinion as I
dive deeper into this record I'm just
not even finding a whole lot of variety
either maybe even since in some moments
that are making my eyes roll a little
bit like the song live in drag which
seems to be the band trying their hand
at like a screamo track but the riff on
this song only really ends up feeling
like a bit of a knockoff of the guitar
riff on the La Dispute record edit your
hometown or the release skippy rhythm
guitar riff on the track your deep rest
which sounds like something straight out
of a Third Eye Blind song and that vibe
doesn't really change up when the song
gets deeper into the verses however it
was kind of moving when I listened to
the song more and more and read into the
lyrics a little bit and found out that
the track is sort of really about
dealing with the grief of losing a close
friend and sort of as a result of this
misery of skipping out on the funeral
pretty hard-hitting realization which
I've had several of across the tracklist
of this record just listening to the
lyrics specifically on other tracks like
house broken you know overall I thought
this record was decent I liked quite a
few tracks on it and I'm glad there are
bands out there right now that are
sticking to this style and not doing it
the injustice that I thought a handful
of groups were in the 2000s that were
blending this genre of music with really
really really clear just elements of pop
just radio friendly saccharine pop you
know groups like this truly appreciate
the roots and the origins and and the
sound however still in their very deep
appreciation and emulation they're yet
to come through with a distinct take or
style aside from just a sheer lack of
surprises and some tracks really paling
in comparison to others I'm not really
finding a whole lot to complain about
you know the hotelier if
you're gonna be into this new strain of
bands in emo Midwestern emo you could do
